title: Come ONE, Come ALL
body_text:
WALL v. ALL at 135:
The Sixth Confrontation!
The intensifying Wolf-Londono rivalry got off to a heated start at DODGEBALL 135, which featured the sixth occurrence of
RIVALRY of the Year
2007:
WALL vs. ALL
. Complete with faceshots, last chance rimshots, and fearless play on both sides,
WALL vs. ALL 6
fully lived up to its expectations.
Continuing their dominance at the event, WALL swept the first three games, but not without a fight. Averaging half an hour each, WALL was consistently down to a handful of players before a game saving rimshot turned the tide in their favor – one of which was executed by Justin Wolf as the lone man on the court. While ALL fought valiantly – at one point having key member John Tronolone take on the entire WALL team by himself and almost stealing victory – it seemed that another embarrassing defeat was in the works.
Game 4 featured a dramatic turnaround led by the "Muffin Man" himself, Juan Londono. After key throws all game, their opponents were whittled down to none other than 2007
PLAYER of the Year
Kevin Adams. Blocking with a painball, Juan and Kevin Megill survived a heartless barrage of bullets from "Dr. Adams", earning ALL its first victory of the game. Emboldened, ALL mustered all its strength against a shrunken WALL team to earn its second consecutive victory in short fashion.
But the comeback was not to be. Wolf and Zach Katz survived a desperate attack to tie the game up, and their elite dodging turned the game around and secured the victory for the "Knights". A bulletball smacking the chest of John Tronolone at 10:37pm sealed the deal. WALL 4, ALL 2.
Flash Results by Game
WALL: 1, 2, 3, 6
ALL: 4, 5
The YEARBOOK
Members of the sixth incarnation of Team ALL came from the following schools:
Neptune
(M. Brown, R. Brown, Butler)
; Manasquan
(Kelly, Londono, Megill)
; Pennington
(Auchinleck, D'Luhy)
; Monmouth Regional
(Schultheis, Tronolone)
;Ocean Township
(Edwards, Vetrano)
; M.A.S.T.
(Cornero)
; Allentown
(DiBuccio)
The Rules
: Classic two-team match-up.
The Match
: Team WALL defeated Team ALL, 4 to 2.
Moments & Stars
: Travis Mills's various comedic dodging throughout 135; Juan Londono pelted in the right eye by Kevin Adams;
Attendance
: 25 competitors, comprised of 19 men and 6 women.
New Players
: Cait Schultheis, Tom "TJ" Auchinleck
Other Notes
: This was the first
WALL vs. ALL
match-up that did not take place at a "three" event or "seven" event. Attendance (female, male, and overall) completely mirrored that of DODGEBALL 134.
EastCoastDodgeball
would like to thank "The Crazy One" Michael Edwards for providing these in depth results!
Coming Up Next
... Wouldn't you like to know?
body_html:
WALL v. ALL at 135:
The Sixth Confrontation!

The intensifying Wolf-Londono rivalry got off to a heated start at DODGEBALL 135, which featured the sixth occurrence of RIVALRY of the Year 2007: WALL vs. ALL. Complete with faceshots, last chance rimshots, and fearless play on both sides, WALL vs. ALL 6 fully lived up to its expectations.

Continuing their dominance at the event, WALL swept the first three games, but not without a fight. Averaging half an hour each, WALL was consistently down to a handful of players before a game saving rimshot turned the tide in their favor – one of which was executed by Justin Wolf as the lone man on the court. While ALL fought valiantly – at one point having key member John Tronolone take on the entire WALL team by himself and almost stealing victory – it seemed that another embarrassing defeat was in the works.

Game 4 featured a dramatic turnaround led by the "Muffin Man" himself, Juan Londono. After key throws all game, their opponents were whittled down to none other than 2007 PLAYER of the Year Kevin Adams. Blocking with a painball, Juan and Kevin Megill survived a heartless barrage of bullets from "Dr. Adams", earning ALL its first victory of the game. Emboldened, ALL mustered all its strength against a shrunken WALL team to earn its second consecutive victory in short fashion.

But the comeback was not to be. Wolf and Zach Katz survived a desperate attack to tie the game up, and their elite dodging turned the game around and secured the victory for the "Knights". A bulletball smacking the chest of John Tronolone at 10:37pm sealed the deal. WALL 4, ALL 2.

Flash Results by Game
WALL: 1, 2, 3, 6
ALL: 4, 5

The YEARBOOK
Members of the sixth incarnation of Team ALL came from the following schools:
Neptune (M. Brown, R. Brown, Butler); Manasquan (Kelly, Londono, Megill); Pennington (Auchinleck, D'Luhy); Monmouth Regional (Schultheis, Tronolone);Ocean Township (Edwards, Vetrano); M.A.S.T. (Cornero); Allentown (DiBuccio)

The Rules: Classic two-team match-up.
The Match: Team WALL defeated Team ALL, 4 to 2.
Moments & Stars: Travis Mills's various comedic dodging throughout 135; Juan Londono pelted in the right eye by Kevin Adams;
Attendance: 25 competitors, comprised of 19 men and 6 women.
New Players: Cait Schultheis, Tom "TJ" Auchinleck
Other Notes: This was the first WALL vs. ALL match-up that did not take place at a "three" event or "seven" event. Attendance (female, male, and overall) completely mirrored that of DODGEBALL 134.

EastCoastDodgeball would like to thank "The Crazy One" Michael Edwards for providing these in depth results!

Coming Up Next ... Wouldn't you like to know?
